answers.answer: I don'tknow of any doctors that offer iinduction until 40+ but under the circumstances I would ask the doctor directly they may notbe so strict.Sorry tohear about your ffatherand hope you the best
I also have gestational diabetes so I'm getting induced early anyway just don't know when x

A lot of doctors now a days will actually offer to induced between 37-40wks, doctor for my first daughter did. Never hurts to ask, but I'm so sorry to hear about your father, bless you, your baby & your family
No doctor will induce you until you are at least 39+ weeks... Try not stress out to much and sorry for your loss
I was meant to be induced at 37 weeks cos I couldn't control my diabetes so I changed my diet I'll ask about it tomorrow

My doctor will not induce before 39 weeks because of hospital protocol (unless its an emergency) but thats not to say that no doctor will do it earlier than that because each state/country/hospital has different laws and regulations that they go by. When younger the chance you should just talk to your doctor directly it won't hurt to ask even if he says no. Best of luck to you :) and sorry for your loss

I agree. With jasmine1670. Here in San Antonio Texas my doctor didn't want to induce me at 37weeks. She told me I would have to wait till 39 weeks.. all state are different.. best of luck to you. I'm sorry for your lost.. I was about 8months pregnant when my family got the news of my grandma.. missing for 6yr was found deceased...
I'm sorry to hear that :( and I'm from the UK lol they induce 37-40  weeks well my hospital does. But I'm not sure they will for this reason
I had gestational diabetes and was induce at 39 weeks that's here Georgia

I'm so sorry for your loss.  I lost my brother last week and was going to ask the doctor to induce so I could travel as I live 5 hrs away from our hometown.  I couldn't bring myself to do it though. I'd say w GD they would be more inclined to say yes though. It is always worth a shot

I'm sorry for your loss. My grandfather passed away before my daughter was born. I tried to put off being induced so I could attend his memorial. I ended up delivering on my own the day of his memorial. I would hate for you to postpone your fathers service and be in the same situation. I know it's not how you want to go about it but maybe you should plan the service before being induced. Just something to think about.

I can't plan nothing as we haven't got death certificate then. I know I'm getting induced around 39 weeks due to gestational diabetes I'm scared it falls on the service and I'm sorry to hear about everyone's loss x

question: Hi everyone I'm 37+1 and basically my dad passed away yesterday. I'm scared incase I stress my baby out with the funeral ect. Can I asked to be induced to attempt to get the baby out on time for the funeral? I haven't started to plan it yet.
title: Induced?
